Engine.enginePackage

Class JeriCustomServerSetup

  • java.lang.Object
    • Engine.enginePackage.JeriCustomServerSetup

  • public final class JeriCustomServerSetup
extends java.lang.Object
    A class for exporting the server using Jeri.

    Use the #export(int,StorytellerRemote) or #export(int,int,StorytellerRemote) method to do the export.

    Tweak the getSerializedLengthLimit(Method, int, Class) method to adjust the limits accepted for different types in the parameters of remote calls.

    The setup implements some restrictions on the use of the remote interface. It limits the amount of data per method parameter, limits the amount of socket connections that can be opened from a given IP, limits the amount of time that a socket remains opened without receiving any data (set through Socket.setSoTimeout(int)), and limits the amount of threads to be used in the server to dispatch rmi requests.

    These measures are to prevent clients from taking all of the server memory, or all of the server sockets.

    As the above implies replacing the default RMI factory we can not benefit from the super socket power implemented there to connect to clients behind proxies using http tunneling. Therefore, here we also setup things so clients can connect either directly through JRMP or through JRMP using http tunneling.

                                       int httpport)
                                throws java.rmi.server.ExportException
        Exports the server using JERI to listen on the given port for jrmp over http.
        Parameters:
        httpport - the port to listen for remote invocations.
        r - the remote object to export.

      • export

        public static StorytellerRemote export(StorytellerRemote r,
                                       int port,
                                       int httpport)
                                throws java.rmi.server.ExportException
        Exports the server using JERI to listen on a given port for jrmp over tcp, and for jrmp over http on another port.
        Parameters:
        port - the port to listen for remote invocations using jrmp over tcp.
        httpport - the port to listen for remote invocations using jrmp over http.
        r - the remote object to export.
        Throws:
        java.rmi.server.ExportException
